question: Why do banks borrow money in the call money market?
option1: To meet sudden demand for funds arising out of large outflows
option2: To fill the temporary mismatches in funds
option3: To meet the Statutory reserve requirements
explanation: Banks can borrow money in the call money market for the following reasons: To cover the gaps or temporary mismatches in funds To meet the Statutory reserve requirements such as Cash Reserve Ratio(CRR) & Statutory Liquidity Ratio(SLR) To meet sudden demand for funds arising out of large outflows.
